newsitem.title: UK: Biocompatibles sets four-for-23 rights issue.
newsitem.headline: Biocompatibles sets four-for-23 rights issue.

text.p: British biotechnology company Biocompatibles International Plc said on Wednesday it planned to raise about 45.5 million stg through a four-for-23 rights issue at 500p per share.
The issues will apply to shares held as of November 29.

The company previously said it planned to raise the money to fund its acquisition of advanced stent technology, or surgery products, based on designs by Divysios Solutions Ltd using Biocompatibles' phosphorylcholine coating.
Under the deal, Biocompatibles will pay an initial $14 million, while Divysios will use the cash to subscribe for the UK company's new shares within the rights issue.
Biocompatibles said in a statement it expected the first products from its collaboration with the Canadian firm to reach the market next year.
Biocompatibles' shares shot up 16p to 597 at 1250 GMT.
